APIListChunking.description: Enable the API clients to retrieve (`LIST` or `GET`) resources from API server in chunks.

APIPriorityAndFairness.description: Enable managing request concurrency with prioritization and fairness at each server. (Renamed from `RequestManagement`)

APIResponseCompression.description: Compress the API responses for `LIST` or `GET` requests

APIServerIdentity.description: Assign each API server an ID in a cluster

APIServerTracing.description: Enable distributed tracing in the API server

Accelerators.description: Enable Nvidia GPU support when using Docker

AllowExtTrafficLocalEndpoints.description: Enable a service to route external requests to node local endpoints

AllowInsecureBackendProxy.description: Enable the users to skip TLS verification of kubelets on Pod log requests

AnyVolumeDataSource.description: Enable use of any custom resource as the `dataSource` of PersistentVolumeClaim

AppArmor.description: Enable AppArmor based mandatory access control on Linux nodes when using Docker

AttachVolumeLimit.description: Enable volume plugins to report limits on number of volumes that can be attached to a node

BalanceAttachedNodeVolumes.description: Include volume count on node to be considered for balanced resource allocation while scheduling. A node which has closer CPU, memory utilization, and volume count is favored by the scheduler while making decisions.

BlockVolume.description: Enable the definition and consumption of raw block devices in Pods. See [Raw Block Volume Support](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#raw-block-volume-support) for more details.

BoundServiceAccountTokenVolume.description: Migrate ServiceAccount volumes to use a projected volume consisting of a ServiceAccountTokenVolumeProjection. Cluster admins can use metric `serviceaccount_stale_tokens_total` to monitor workloads that are depending on the extended tokens. If there are no such workloads, turn off extended tokens by starting `kube-apiserver` with flag `--service-account-extend-token-expiration=false`.

CPUManager.description: Enable container level CPU affinity support, see [CPU Management Policies](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/cpu-management-policies/) for more details.

CPUManagerPolicyAlphaOptions.description: This allows fine-tuning of CPUManager policies, experimental, Alpha-quality options This feature gate will guard *a group* of CPUManager options whose quality level is Alpha. This feature gate will never graduate to Beta or Stable.

CPUManagerPolicyBetaOptions.description: This allows fine-tuning of CPUManager policies, experimental, Beta-quality options This feature gate will guard *a group* of CPUManager options whose quality level is Beta. This feature gate will never graduate to stable.

CRIContainerLogRotation.description: Enable container log rotation for CRI container runtime. The default max size of a log file is 10MB and the default max number of log files allowed for a container is 5. These values can be configured in the kubelet config. See the [logging at node level](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/logging/#logging-at-the-node-level) documentation for more details.

CSIBlockVolume.description: Enable external CSI volume drivers to support block storage.

CSIDriverRegistry.description: Enable all logic related to the CSIDriver API object in "csi.storage.k8s.io"

CSIInlineVolume.description: Enable CSI Inline volumes support for Pods.

CSIMigration.description: Enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from in-tree plugins to corresponding pre-installed CSI plugins

CSIMigrationAWS.description: Enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the AWS-EBS in-tree plugin to EBS CSI plugin. Supports falling back to in-tree EBS plugin if a node does not have EBS CSI plugin installed and configured. Requires `CSIMigration` feature flag enabled.

CSIMigrationAWSComplete.description: Stops registering the EBS in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the AWS-EBS in-tree plugin to EBS CSI plugin.  Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationAWS feature flags enabled and EBS CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

CSIMigrationAzureDisk.description: Enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the Azure-Disk in-tree plugin to AzureDisk CSI plugin.  Supports falling back to in-tree AzureDisk plugin if a node does not have AzureDisk CSI plugin installed and configured. Requires the `CSIMigration` feature flag enabled.

CSIMigrationAzureDiskComplete.description: Stops registering the Azure-Disk in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the Azure-Disk in-tree plugin to AzureDisk CSI plugin. Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationAzureDisk feature flags enabled and AzureDisk CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

CSIMigrationAzureFile.description: Enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the Azure-File in-tree plugin to AzureFile CSI plugin.  Supports falling back to in-tree AzureFile plugin if a node does not have AzureFile CSI plugin installed and configured. Requires the `CSIMigration` feature flag enabled.

CSIMigrationAzureFileComplete.description: Stops registering the Azure-File in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the Azure-File in-tree plugin to AzureFile CSI plugin. Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationAzureFile feature flags  enabled and AzureFile CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

CSIMigrationGCE.description: Enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the GCE-PD in-tree plugin to PD CSI plugin. Supports falling back to in-tree GCE plugin if a node does not have PD CSI plugin installed and configured. Requires the `CSIMigration` feature flag enabled.

CSIMigrationGCEComplete.description: Stops registering the GCE-PD in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the GCE-PD in-tree plugin to PD CSI plugin.  Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationGCE feature flags enabled and PD CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

CSIMigrationOpenStack.description: Enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the Cinder in-tree plugin to Cinder CSI plugin. Supports falling back to in-tree Cinder plugin if a node does not have Cinder CSI plugin installed and configured. Requires the `CSIMigration` feature flag enabled.

CSIMigrationOpenStackComplete.description: Stops registering the Cinder in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the Cinder in-tree plugin to Cinder CSI plugin.  Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationOpenStack feature flags enabled and Cinder CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

CSIMigrationPortworx.description: Stops registering the Portworx in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the Portworx in-tree plugin to its CSI plugin. Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationPortworx feature flags enabled and Portworx CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

csiMigrationRBD.description: Stops registering the RBD in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the RBD in-tree plugin to its CSI plugin. Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationRBD feature flags enabled and RBD CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

CSIMigrationvSphere.description: Enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the vSphere in-tree plugin to vSphere CSI plugin.  Supports falling back to in-tree vSphere plugin if a node does not have vSphere CSI plugin installed and configured. Requires `CSIMigration` feature flag enabled.

CSIMigrationvSphereComplete.description: Stops registering the vSphere in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers and enables shims and translation logic to route volume operations from the vSphere in-tree plugin to vSphere CSI plugin. Requires CSIMigration and CSIMigrationvSphere feature flags enabled and vSphere CSI plugin installed and configured on all nodes in the cluster.

CSINodeInfo.description: Enable all logic related to the CSINodeInfo API object in "csi.storage.k8s.io".

CSIPersistentVolume.description: Enable discovering and mounting volumes provisioned through a Container Storage Interface(CSI) compatible volume plugin

CSIServiceAccountToken.description: Enable CSI drivers to receive the pods' service account token that they mount volumes for.

CSIStorageCapacity.description: Enables CSI drivers to publish storage capacity information and the Kubernetes scheduler to use that information when scheduling Pods.

CSIVolumeFSGroupPolicy.description: Allows CSIDrivers to use the `fsGroupPolicy` field.  This field controls whether volumes created by a CSIDriver support volume ownership and permission modifications when these volumes are mounted.

CSIVolumeHealth.description: Enable support for CSI volume health monitoring on node.

CSRDuration.description: Allows clients to request a duration for certificates issued via the Kubernetes CSR API.Enable support for CSI volume health monitoring on node.

ConfigurableFSGroupPolicy.description: Allows user to configure volume permission change policy for fsGroups when mounting a volume in a Pod.

ContextualLogging.description: When you enable this feature gate, Kubernetes components that support contextual logging add extra detail to log output.

ControllerManagerLeaderMigration.description: Enables leader migration for kube-controller-manager and cloud-controller-manager

CronJobControllerV2.description: Use an alternative implementation of the CronJob controller. Otherwise, version 1 of the same controller is selected.  The version 2 controller provides experimental performance improvements.

CustomCPUCFSQuotaPeriod.description: Enable nodes to change `cpuCFSQuotaPeriod` in kubelet config file.

CustomPodDNS.description: Enable customizing the DNS settings for a Pod using its `dnsConfig` property.

CustomResourceDefaulting.description: Enable CRD support for default values in OpenAPI v3 validation schemas.

CustomResourcePublishOpenAPI.description: Enables publishing of CRD OpenAPI specs.

CustomResourceSubresources.description: Enable `/status` and `/scale` subresources on resources created from a CustomResourceDefinition

CustomResourceValidation.description: Enable schema based validation on resources created from a CustomResourceDefinition

CustomResourceValidationExpressions.description: Enable expression language validation in CRD which will validate customer resource based on validation rules written in `x-kubernetes-validations` extension.

CustomResourceWebhookConversion.description: Enable webhook-based conversion on resources created from a CustomResourceDefinition

DaemonSetUpdateSurge.description: Enables the DaemonSet workloads to maintain availability during update per node

DefaultPodTopologySpread.description: Enables the use of `PodTopologySpread` scheduling plugin to do default spreading

DelegateFSGroupToCSIDriver.description: Enable the [device-plugins](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/extend-kubernetes/compute-storage-net/device-plugins/) based resource provisioning on nodes.

DevicePlugins.description: Enable the [device-plugins](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/extend-kubernetes/compute-storage-net/device-plugins/) based resource provisioning on nodes.

DisableAcceleratorUsageMetrics.description: Disable accelerator metrics collected by the kubelet

DisableCloudProviders.description: Disables any functionality in 'kube-apiserver', 'kube-controller-manager' and 'kubelet' related to the '--cloud-provider' component flag.

DisableKubeletCloudCredentialProviders.description: Disable the in-tree functionality in kubelet to authenticate to a cloud provider container registry for image pull credentials.

DryRun.description: Enable server-side [dry run](https://k8s,io/docs/reference/using-api/api-concepts/#dry-run) requests so that validation, merging, and mutation can be tested without committing.

DynamicKubeletConfig.description: Enable the dynamic configuration of kubelet. See [Reconfigure kubelet](https://k8s,io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/reconfigure-kubelet/) for more details

DynamicProvisioningScheduling.description: Extend the default scheduler to be aware of volume topology and handle PV provisioning.  This feature is superseded by the `VolumeScheduling` feature completely in v1.12.

DynamicVolumeProvisioning.description: Enable the [dynamic provisioning](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/dynamic-provisioning/) of persistent volumes to Pods.

EfficientWatchResumption.description: Allows for storage-originated bookmark (progress notify) events to be delivered to the users. This is only applied to watch operations.

EnableAggregatedDiscoveryTimeout.description: Enable the five second timeout on aggregated discovery calls. This is a shortlived feature gate that is deprecated when introduced.

EnableEquivalenceClassCache.description: Enable the scheduler to cache equivalence of nodes when scheduling Pods.

EndpointSlice.description: Enables EndpointSlices for more scalable and extensible network endpoints.

EndpointSliceProxying.description: When enabled, kube-proxy running on Linux will use EndpointSlices as the primary data source instead of Endpoints, enabling scalability and performance improvements. See [Enabling Endpoint Slices](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/enabling-endpointslices/).

EphemeralContainers.description: Enable the ability to add ephemeral containers to running Pods.

EvenPodsSpread.description: Enable Pods to be scheduled evenly across topology domains. See [Pod Topology Spread Constraints](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-topology-spread-constraints/).

ExecProbeTimeout.description: Ensure kubelet respects exec probe timeouts.  This feature gate exists in case any of your existing workloads depend on a now-corrected fault where Kubernetes ignored exec probe timeouts. See [readiness probes](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/#configure-probes).

ExpandCSIVolumes.description: Enable the expanding of CSI volumes.

ExpandInUsePersistentVolumes.description: Enable expanding in-use PVCs. See [Resizing an in-use PersistentVolumeClaim](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#resizing-an-in-use-persistentvolumeclaim).

ExpandPersistentVolumes.description: Enable the expanding of persistent volumes. See [Expanding Persistent Volumes Claims](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#expanding-persistent-volumes-claims).

ExpandedDNSConfig.description: Enables the API server and the kubelet to allow up to 32 DNS search paths and up to 2048 characters in the DNS search list.

ExperimentalCriticalPodAnnotation.description: Enable annotating specific pods as *critical* so that their scheduling is guaranteed. This feature is deprecated by Pod Priority and Preemption as of v1.13.

ExperimentalHostUserNamespaceDefaulting.description: Enabling the defaulting user namespace to host. This is for containers that are using other host namespaces, host mounts, or containers that are privileged or using specific non-namespaced capabilities (e.g. `MKNODE`, `SYS_MODULE` etc.). This should only be enabled if user namespace remapping is enabled in the Docker daemon.

ExternalPolicyForExternalIP.description: Fix a bug where ExternalTrafficPolicy is not applied to Service ExternalIPs.

GCERegionalPersistentDisk.description: Enable the regional PD feature on GCE.

GRPCContainerProbe.description: Enables GRPC probe method for liveness probes, readiness probes, or startup probes.

GenericEphemeralVolume.description: Enables ephemeral, inline volumes that support all features of normal volumes (can be provided by third-party storage vendors, storage capacity tracking, restore from snapshot, etc.).

GracefulNodeShutdown.description: Enables support for graceful shutdown in kubelet.  During a system shutdown, kubelet will attempt to detect the shutdown event and gracefully terminate pods running on the node. See [Graceful Node Shutdown](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#graceful-node-shutdown) for more details.

GracefulNodeShutdownBasedOnPodPriority.description: Enables support for graceful shutdown in kubelet.  During a system shutdown, kubelet will attempt to detect the shutdown event and gracefully terminate pods running on the node. See [Graceful Node Shutdown](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#graceful-node-shutdown) for more details.

HonorPVReclaimPolicy.description: Honor persistent volume reclaim policy when it is `Delete` irrespective of PV-PVC deletion ordering.

HPAContainerMetrics.description: Enable the `HorizontalPodAutoscaler` to scale based on metrics from individual containers in target Pods.

HPAScaleToZero.description: Enables setting `minReplicas` to 0 for `HorizontalPodAutoscaler` resources when using custom or external metrics.

HugePageStorageMediumSize.description: Enable support for multiple sizes pre-allocated [huge pages](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/manage-hugepages/scheduling-hugepages/).

HugePages.description: Enable the allocation and consumption of pre-allocated [huge pages](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/manage-hugepages/scheduling-hugepages/).

IPv6DualStack.description: Enable dual stack support for IPv6.

IdentifyPodOS.description: Allows the Pod OS field to be specified. This helps in identifying the OS of the pod authoritatively during the API server admission time. In Kubernetes 1.23, the allowed values for the `pod.spec.os.name` are `windows` and `linux`.

ImmutableEphemeralVolumes.description: Allows for marking individual Secrets and ConfigMaps as immutable for better safety and performance.

InTreePluginAWSUnregister.description: Stops registering the aws-ebs in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

InTreePluginAzureDiskUnregister.description: Stops registering the azuredisk in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

InTreePluginAzureFileUnregister.description: Stops registering the azurefile in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

InTreePluginGCEUnregister.description: Stops registering the gce-pd in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

InTreePluginOpenStackUnregister.description: Stops registering the OpenStack cinder in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

InTreePluginPortworxUnregister.description: Stops registering the Portworx in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

InTreePluginRBDUnregister.description: Stops registering the RBD in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

InTreePluginvSphereUnregister.description: Stops registering the vSphere in-tree plugin in kubelet and volume controllers

IndexedJob.description: Allows the Job controllers to manage Pod completions per completion index.

IngressClassNamespacedParams.description: Allow namespace-scoped parameters reference in `IngressClass` resouce. This feature adds two fields - `Scope` and `Namespace` to `IngressClass.spec.parameters`.

Initializers.description: Allow asynchronous coordination of object creation using the Initializers admission plugin.

JobMutableNodeSchedulingDirectives.description: Allows updating node scheduling directives in the Pod template of a Job.

JobReadyPods.description: Enables tracking the number of Pods that have a `Ready` condition. The count of `Ready` Pods is recorded in the status of a Job.

JobTrackingWithFinalizers.description: Enables tracking Job completions without relying on Pods remaining in the cluster indefinitely.  The Job controller uses Pod finalizers and a field in the Job status to keep track of the finished Pods to count towards completion.

KubeletConfigFile.description: Enable loading kubelet configuration from a file specified using a config file. See [setting kubelet parameters via a config file](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/kubelet-config-file/) for more details.

KubeletCredentialProviders.description: Enable kubelet exec credential providers for image pull credentials.

KubeletInUserNamespace.description: Enables support for running kubelet in a user namespace. See [Running Kubernetes Node Components as a Non-root User](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/kubelet-in-userns/).).

KubeletPluginsWatcher.description: Enable probe-based plugin watcher utility to enable kubelet to discover plugins such as [CSI volume drivers](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#csi).

KubeletPodResources.description: Enable the kubelet's Pod resources gRPC endpoint.

KubeletPodResourcesGetAllocatable.description: Enable the kubelet's pod resources `GetAllocatableResources` functionality. With informations about the allocatable resources, clients can properly track the free compute resources on a node.

LegacyNodeRoleBehavior.description: When disabled, legacy behavior in service load balancers and node disruption will ignore the `node-role.kubernetes.io/master` label in favor of the feature-specific labels provided by `NodeDisruptionExclusion` and `ServiceNodeExclusion`.

LegacyServiceAccountTokenNoAutoGeneratio.description: Stop auto-generation of Secret-based service account tokens.

LocalStorageCapacityIsolation.description: Enable the consumption of local ephemeral storage and also the `sizeLimit` property of an emptyDir volume.

LocalStorageCapacityIsolationFSQuotaMoni.description: When `LocalStorageCapacityIsolation` is enabled for [local ephemeral storage](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/) and the backing filesystem for [emptyDir volumes](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#emptydir) supports project quotas and they are enabled, use project quotas to monitor [emptyDir volume](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#emptydir) storage consumption rather than filesystem walk for better performance and accuracy.

LogarithmicScaleDown.description: Enable semi-random selection of pods to evict on controller scaledown based on logarithmic bucketing of pod timestamps.

MaxUnavailableStatefulSet.description: Enables setting the `maxUnavailable` field for the rolling update strategy of a StatefulSet. The field specifies the maximum number of Pods that can be unavailable during the update.

MemoryManager.description: Allows setting memory affinity for a container based on NUMA topology.

MemoryQoS.description: Enable memory protection and usage throttle on pod / container using cgroup v2 memory controller.

MinDomainsInPodTopologySpread.description: Enable `minDomains` in Pod topology spread constraints.

MixedProtocolLBService.description: Enable using different protocols in the same `LoadBalancer` type Service instance.

MountContainers.description: Enable using utility containers on host as the volume mounter.

MountPropagation.description: Enable sharing volume mounted by one container to other containers or Pods.

NamespaceDefaultLabelName.description: Configure the API Server to set an immutable label `kubernetes.io/metadata.name` on all namespaces, containing the namespace name.

NetworkPolicyEndPort.description: Enable use of the field `endPort` in NetworkPolicy objects, allowing the selection of a port range instead of a single port.

NetworkPolicyStatus.description: Enable the `status` subresource for NetworkPolicy objects.

NodeDisruptionExclusion.description: Enable use of the Node label `node.kubernetes.io/exclude-disruption` which prevents nodes from being evacuated during zone failures.

NodeLease.description: Enable the new Lease API to report node heartbeats, which could be used as a node health signal.

NodeOutOfServiceVolumeDetach.description: When a Node is marked out-of-service using the `node.kubernetes.io/out-of-service` taint, Pods on the node will be forcefully deleted if they can not tolerate this taint, and the volume detach operations for Pods terminating on the node will happen immediately. The deleted Pods can recover quickly on different nodes.

NodeSwap.description: Enable the kubelet to allocate swap memory for Kubernetes workloads on a node. Must be used with `KubeletConfiguration.failSwapOn` set to false.  For more details, please see [swap memory](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#swap-memory).

NonPreemptingPriority.description: Enable `preemptionPolicy` field for PriorityClass and Pod.

OpenAPIEnums.description: Enables populating 'enum' fields of OpenAPI schemas in the spec returned from the API server.

OpenAPIV3.description: Enable Kubernetes to publish OpenAPI v3.

PVCProtection.description: Enable the prevention of a PersistentVolumeClaim (PVC) from being deleted when it is still used by any Pod. Evolved into the `StorageObjectInUseProtection` gate in v1.10.

PersistentLocalVolumes.description: Enable the usage of `local` volume type in Pods.  Pod affinity has to be specified if requesting a `local` volume.

PodAffinityNamespaceSelector.description: Enable the Pod affinity namespace selector and CrossNamespacePodAffinity quota scope features.

PodAndContainerStatsFromCRI.description: Configure the kubelet to gather container and pod stats from the CRI container runtime rather than gathering them from cAdvisor.

PodDeletionCost.description: Enable the [Pod Deletion Cost](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicaset/#pod-deletion-cost) feature which allows users to influence ReplicaSet downscaling order.

PodOverhead.description: Enable the [PodOverhead](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/pod-overhead/) feature to account for pod overheads.

PodPriority.description: Enable the descheduling and preemption of Pods based on their [priorities](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/).

PodReadinessGates.description: Enable the setting of `PodReadinessGate` field for extending Pod readiness evaluation.  See [Pod readiness gate](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#pod-readiness-gate) for more details.

PodSecurity.description: Enables the `PodSecurity` admission plugin as an alternative to `PodSecurityPolicy`.

PodShareProcessNamespace.description: Enable the setting of `shareProcessNamespace` in a Pod for sharing a single process namespace between containers running in a pod.  More details can be found in [share process namespace between containers in a Pod](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/share-process-namespace/).

PreferNominatedNode.description: This flag tells the scheduler whether the nominated nodes will be checked first before looping through all the other nodes in the cluster.

ProcMountType.description: Enables control over the type proc mounts for containers by setting the `procMount` field of a SecurityContext.

ProxyTerminatingEndpoints.description: Enable the `kube-proxy` to handle terminating endpoints when `ExternalTrafficPolicy=Local`

QOSReserved.description: Allows resource reservations at the QoS level preventing pods at lower QoS levels from bursting into resources requested at higher QoS levels (memory only for now).

ReadWriteOncePod.description: Enables the usage of `ReadWriteOncePod` PersistentVolume access mode.

RecoverVolumeExpansionFailure.description: Enables users to edit their PVCs to smaller sizes so as they can recover from previously issued volume expansion failures. See [Recovering from Failure when Expanding Volumes](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#recovering-from-failure-when-expanding-volumes).

RemainingItemCount.description: Allow the API servers to show a count of remaining items in the response to a chunked list request.

RemoveSelfLink.description: Deprecates and removes `selfLink` from ObjectMeta and ListMeta.

RequestManagement.description: Enables managing request concurrency with prioritization and fairness at each API server. Deprecated by `APIPriorityAndFairness` since v1.17.

ResourceLimitsPriorityFunction.description: Enable a scheduler priority function that assigns a lowest possible score of 1 to a node that satisfies at least one of the input Pod's cpu and memory limits. The intent is to break ties between nodes with same scores.

RootCAConfigMap.description: Configure the `kube-controller-manager` to publish a ConfigMap named `kube-root-ca.crt` to every namespace. This ConfigMap contains a CA bundle used for verifying connections to the kube-apiserver.

RotateKubeletClientCertificate.description: Enable the rotation of the client TLS certificate on the kubelet.

RotateKubeletServerCertificate.description: Enable the rotation of the server TLS certificate on the kubelet.

RunAsGroup.description: Enable control over the primary group ID set on the init processes of containers.

RuntimeClass.description: Enable the [RuntimeClass](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/containers/runtime-class/) feature for selecting container runtime configurations.

SCTPSupport.description: Enables the SCTP `protocol` value in Pod, Service, Endpoints, EndpointSlice, and NetworkPolicy definitions.

ScheduleDaemonSetPods.description: Enable DaemonSet Pods to be scheduled by the default scheduler instead of the DaemonSet controller.

SeccompDefault.description: Enables the use of `RuntimeDefault` as the default seccomp profile for all workloads. The seccomp profile is specified in the `securityContext` of a Pod and/or a Container.

SelectorIndex.description: Allows label and field based indexes in API server watch cache to accelerate list operations.

ServerSideApply.description: Enables the [Sever Side Apply (SSA)](https://k8s.io/docs/reference/using-api/server-side-apply/) feature on the API Server.

ServiceAccountIssuerDiscovery.description: Enable OIDC discovery endpoints (issuer and JWKS URLs) for the service account issuer in the API server.

ServiceAppProtocol.description: Enables the `AppProtocol` field on Services and Endpoints.

ServiceIPStaticSubrange.description: Enables a strategy for Services ClusterIP allocations, whereby the ClusterIP range is subdivided. Dynamic allocated ClusterIP addresses will be allocated preferently from the upper range allowing users to assign static ClusterIPs from the lower range with a low risk of collision.

ServiceLoadBalancerClass.description: Enables the `loadBalancerClass` field on Services. See [specifying class of load balancer implementation](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#specifying-class-of-load-balancer-implementation-load-balancer-class) for more details.

ServiceLoadBalancerFinalizer.description: Enable finalizer protection for Service load balancers.

ServiceNodeExclusion.description: Enable the exclusion of nodes from load balancers created by a cloud provider. A node is eligible for exclusion if labelled with "`node.kubernetes.io/exclude-from-external-load-balancers`".

ServiceTopology.description: Enable service to route traffic based upon the Node topology of the cluster. See [ServiceTopology](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service-topology/) for more details.

SetHostnameAsFQDN.description: Enable setting Fully Qualified Domain Name(FQDN) as the hostname of a pod by specifying its `setHostnameFQDN` field.

SizeMemoryBackedVolumes.description: Enable kubelets to determine the size limit for memory-backed volumes (mainly `emptyDir` volumes).

StartupProbe.description: Enable the [startup](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle/#when-should-you-use-a-startup-probe) probe in the kubelet.

StatefulSetAutoDeletePVC.description: Enables polices controlling the deletion of PVCs created by a StatefulSet.

StatefulSetMinReadySeconds.description: Allows `minReadySeconds` to be respected by the StatefulSet controller.

StorageObjectInUseProtection.description: Postpone the deletion of PersistentVolume or PersistentVolumeClaim objects if they are still being used.

StorageVersionHash.description: Allow API servers to expose the storage version hash in the discovery.

StreamingProxyRedirects.description: Instructs the API server to intercept (and follow) redirects from the backend (kubelet) for streaming requests. Examples of streaming requests include the `exec`, `attach` and `port-forward` requests.

SupportIPVSProxyMode.description: Enable providing in-cluster service load balancing using IPVS.

SupportNodePidsLimit.description: Enable the support to limiting PIDs on the Node.  The parameter `pid=<number>` in the `--system-reserved` and `--kube-reserved` options can be specified to ensure that the specified number of process IDs will be reserved for the system as a whole and for Kubernetes system daemons respectively.

SupportPodPidsLimit.description: Enable the support to limiting PIDs in Pods.

SuspendJob.description: Enable support to suspend and resume Jobs.

Sysctls.description: Enable support for namespaced kernel parameters (sysctls) that can be set for each Pod.

TTLAfterFinished.description: Allow a [TTL controller](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/ttlafterfinished/) to clean up resources after they finish execution.

TaintBasedEvictions.description: Enable evicting pods from nodes based on taints on Nodes and tolerations on Pods.

TaintNodesByCondition.description: Enable automatic tainting nodes based on node conditions.

TokenRequest.description: Enable the `TokenRequest` endpoint on service account resources.

TokenRequestProjection.description: Enable the injection of service account tokens into a Pod through a [`projected` volume](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#projected)

TopologyAwareHints.description: Enables topology aware routing based on topology hints in EndpointSlices. See [Topology Aware Hints](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/topology-aware-hints/) for more details.

TopologyManager.description: Enable a mechanism to coordinate fine-grained hardware resource assignments for different components in Kubernetes. See [Control Topology Management Policies on a node](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/topology-manager/).

ValidateProxyRedirects.description: This flag controls whether the API server should validate that redirects are only followed to the same host. Only used if the `StreamingProxyRedirects` flag is enabled.

VolumeCapacityPriority.description: Enable support for prioritizing nodes in different topologies based on available PV capacity.

VolumePVCDataSource.description: Enable support for specifying an existing PVC as a DataSource.

VolumeScheduling.description: Enable volume topology aware scheduling and make the PersistentVolumeClaim (PVC) binding aware of scheduling decisions. It also enables the usage of [`local`](https://k8s.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#local) volume type when used together with the `PersistentLocalVolumes` feature gate.

VolumeSnapshotDataSource.description: Enable volume snapshot data source support.

VolumeSubpath.description: Allow mounting a subpath of a volume in a container

VolumeSubpathEnvExpansion.description: Enable `subPathExpr` field for expanding environment variables into a `subPath`.

WarningHeaders.description: Allow sending warning headers in API responses.

WatchBookmark.description: Enable support for watch bookmark events.

WinDSR.description: Allows kube-proxy to create DSR loadbalancers for Windows.

WinOverlay.description: Allows kube-proxy to run in overlay mode for Windows.

WindowsEndpointSliceProxying.description: When enabled, kube-proxy running on Windows will use EndpointSlices as the primary data source instead of Endpoints, enabling scalability and performance improvements. See [Enabling EndpointSlices](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/enabling-endpointslices/).

WindowsGMSA.description: Enables passing of GMSA credential specs from pods to container runtimes.

WindowsHostProcessContainers.description: Enables support for Windows HostProcess containers.

WindowsRunAsUserName.description: Enable support for running applications in Windows containers with as a non-default user. See [Configuring RunAsUserName](https://k8s.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-runasusername) for more details.

overview:
Feature gates are a set of key=value pairs that describe Kubernetes features. You can turn these features on or off using the `--feature-gates` command line flag on every Kubernetes components or the corresponding flags in their configuration files. For example:

```shell
--feature-gates="...,DynamicKubeletConfig=true"
```
